Context:
Program Name: Theatre Arts-Preparation
Code: P108
Credential: Ontario College Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 1 year (2 semesters)
Starting Months: September
Domestic Tuition: $4,648.00
International Tuition: $17,649.00
Centre: Arts, Design & Information Technology
School: Media & Performing Arts
Location: Young Centre for the Performing Arts
Program Description: A dynamic one-year program designed to help students obtain basic skills for entry into theatre and media programs. It provides knowledge and skills in performance, business, and production aspects of the performing arts. Courses cover fundamentals of acting for both theatre and film/television industries.

* Semester 1 Delivery: On Campus (Fall 2023)
* Semester 2 Delivery: On Campus (Winter 2024)

Related Programs: Theatre Arts – Performance (P104), Acting for Media (P107), Art and Design Foundation (G108)
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Theatre Arts-Preparation Program P108 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The program offers courses in performing arts for individuals aiming to pursue careers in theatre and film/television industries. Courses cover various aspects of acting, voice and speech, movement, performance styles, Canadian drama, scene study, monologue preparation, audition preparation, career building using social media, and creative process.

Required courses in the first semester include THEA 1021 - Performing Arts Career, THEA 1022 - Performance Styles in Dramatic Literature, THEA 1036 - Fundamentals of Acting, COMM 2000 - Communicating Across Contexts, and THEA 1034 - Kinetic Movement for Actors.

Required courses in the second semester include THEA 1023 - Introduction to Voice and Speech, THEA 2030 - Theatre as Medium, THEA 2033 - Monologue and Audition Preparation, THEA 2047 - Introduction to Scene Study, and THEA 2040 - Creative Process.

Graduates of the program may pursue career opportunities in formal performing arts career-training programs such as Theatre Arts – Performance or Acting for Media. The graduate will be able to employ improvisational skills, analyze different performance styles and genres, develop a career and professional development plan, identify career opportunities, work collaboratively, and interact professionally within the industry.

Domestic tuition fee is $4,648.00, while international tuition is $17,649.00 for the first two semesters. There are additional costs beyond these fees.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Theatre Arts-Preparation Program P108 | George Brown College2023.txt
